summary:
Ninja, also known as shinobi, were skilled spies and warriors in ancient Japan. They were experts in sneaking, fighting, and gathering secret information. These "invisible" warriors worked for different clans during Japan's warring times. The word "ninja" comes from the Japanese word for "one who is invisible."

Over time, ninja became famous in stories and art, often with magical powers. Their secret techniques and training methods were written down in special books. Even though they disappeared after the 1600s, ninja remain iconic symbols of Japanese history and culture.
title: Ninja
